items.description:
G'day everyone, welcome to issue #342 of Weekly Xamarin - a wrapup of the Xamarin and MAUI communities this week.

It's been quite a week and as Rhys James says "Genuinely humiliating to contract the novel coronavirus is March 2022. Feel like I just bought a Dreamcast.". That was my week.

Looking forward to getting back into action and the next release of MAUI.

❤

Kym

items.title: StateLayout with Collections in Xamarin Forms/MAUI
items.description:
StateSquid was a plugin which allowed displaying a specific view when a page is in a specific state. It has evolved and now it’s part of the Xamarin Community Toolkit. This article covers how to use and integrate it to load data into your collections.

items.title: Never write MVVM boilerplate code again! MVVM source generators are here!
items.description:

items.title: How To Use an Existing SQLite Database with Xamarin and .NET MAUI
items.description:
You might want to supply a prebuilt SQLite db file with your app but you're wondering how to do that. Say no more! In this video we will learn how to add the SQLite database file to your app, copy it to the device and actually use it to query data.

How To Use an Existing SQLite Database with Xamarin and .NET MAUI by Gerald Versluis
